newsitem.title: IRAN: Earthquake hits Mashad, no damage reported.
newsitem.headline: Earthquake hits Mashad, no damage reported.

text.p: An earthquake measuring 4.6 on the Richter scale hit the northern Iranian city of Mashad, but there were no immediate reports of casualties or damage, the official Iranian news agency IRNA said on Monday.
It said the quake, which shook the area at 16:52 (1270 GMT) on Sunday, had its epicentre 40 km (25 miles) northwest of Mashad.
Three earthquakes of comparable strength jolted Iran last week, one in the north and two in the south. There were no reports of casualties or damage.
A force four earthquake is powerful enough to cause damage in a populated area.
Earthquakes hit Iran regularly. The worst recorded one, measuring 7.3 on the Richter scale, killed 35,000 people in a densely populated area near the Caspian coast in 1990.
